cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles south of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (forecast to resume a slow northward motion later today)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move north across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, make landfall along the Florida Panhandle, then accelerate northeastward across the southeastern U.S. and Mid-Atlantic, reaching the Northeast U.S. (including New York area) late Thursday night into Friday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings limited to western Cuba and eastern Yucatan Peninsula (Tulum to Cabo Catoche, including Cozumel)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – no U.S. Atlantic coast warnings in effect yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast (especially Florida Panhandle) then Atlantic coast from Georgia through the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England, including NY & NJ
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to near 35–40 mph possible late Thu night–Fri
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected in the New York Harbor; minor tidal departures of 1–2 ft possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain Friday could bring 1–3 inches with localized higher pockets and urban/poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibilities, thunderstorm squalls, and possible river/tributary rises affecting berth operations
